meanings.definition: Relating to the ability to produce offspring.
meanings.sent1: The rabbits engaged in procreative behavior.
meanings.sent2: The birds' procreative instincts led them to build a nest.
meanings.sent3: The procreative nature of the flowers brought color to the garden.
meanings.sent4: The procreative energy of the forest was evident in its growth.
meanings.sent5: The procreative drive of the animals ensured the survival of their species.

meanings.sent2: The fertile soil was procreative for the plants.
meanings.sent3: The procreative ability of the fish amazed the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The procreative power of the sun nourished the crops.
meanings.sent5: The procreative potential of the cells was essential for life.

meanings.sent1: The procreative of the animals was crucial for the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The procreative of the flowers brought beauty to the field.
meanings.sent3: The procreative of the bees was a buzzing success.
meanings.sent4: The procreative of the trees provided shade for the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The procreative of the birds filled the air with chirping melodies.
